As has been observed above, a fideicommissum could be charged on anyone who took a benerit by the decease: i.e. on heirs, testamentary or intestam, legatees, fideicommissarii, donees mortis causa (Dig. 32. 3 ; 31. 77. 1), the fiscus, if the estate came to it as bona vacan- tia (Dig. 30. 114. 2), the heirs of all these persons (Dig. 3²· 5. 1: ib. 6. pn), and the father of a filiusfamilias, or master of a slave, who was insti· tuted orto whom a legacy or fideicommissum was given.
